config.question: What led politicians to support an increase in duty on imported goods during the 1820s?

choices.content: improvements in the river transport system

answer_3.response: The shift to factory production changed capitalist activity. Before the 1820s, New England merchants concentrated mainly on international trade. When the success of Waltham and Lowell became clear, many merchants shifted their capital from oceanic trade to manufacturing. This had important political consequences, as leading politicians no longer advocated a low tariff that favored importers over exporters.
